title: Thinking It Through - purpose of description

content.question: In paragraph 3, sentences 9-11 (“The sounds … produce sounds”), the author’s description of the process by which computers produce the sounds of speech primarily serves to

choices.label: support the argument that computers are able to understand the spoken inputs of their human users
provide a counterargument to the point about tape recorders earlier in the paragraph by showing how much more advanced computers are
highlight a significant difference in the processes that lead humans and computers to produce the sounds of speech
demonstrate that real computers are nearly as impressive as the science fiction depictions of computers referred to in the first paragraph

content.answer: highlight a significant difference in the processes that lead humans and computers to produce the sounds of speech

skill.text: Skill 5.C: Recognize and explain the use of methods of development to accomplish a purpose.
